gumBleeding.title: What Causes Gum Bleeding?
gumBleeding.intro: Gum bleeding is quite an uncomfortable condition. You may notice this type of bleeding when you eat something. You can see this when eating an apple or brushing your teeth.
gumBleeding.mainContent: Gum bleeding mostly occurs due to the accumulation and proliferation of plaque and/or tartar along the gum line. Plaque is a sticky bacterial layer that causes irritation at the gum line and combines with food residues to form acids that can affect teeth.
causes: Using the wrong brush during tooth brushing

diseases.name: Gingivitis
diseases.description: It can be shown as the beginning of gum diseases. It makes the gums very sensitive.

diseases.name: Periodontitis
diseases.description: It is the advanced stage of gingivitis. It can cause tissue damage. Bacterial formation accelerates.

diseases.name: Diabetes
diseases.description: Diabetes can make your body very sensitive. Your sensitized mouth may not be able to resist bacteria.

gumBleeding.vitaminTitle: Do Vitamin Deficiencies Cause Gum Problems?
gumBleeding.vitaminContent: Deficiency of vitamins C or K can also lead to gum bleeding. When we consider your body as a whole, nutrition is in a very valuable chain.
gumBleeding.treatmentContent: Treatment for gum bleeding should not be neglected. Because it is a problem that will affect your daily life. Do not neglect your dental care and gum checks to smile comfortably.

bruxism.title: Teeth Grinding and Clenching (Bruxism) Treatment
bruxism.intro: If you wake up with jaw muscle pain or headache, you may be experiencing bruxism, which means teeth grinding and clenching. Bruxism is involuntary jaw movements during sleep.
bruxism.doctorTitle: Which Doctor Should I Consult for Teeth Clenching?
bruxism.doctorContent: If you clench your teeth, you must definitely see a dentist. You should also consult a psychiatrist for psychological reasons and stress.
bruxism.childrenContent: The aim of teeth grinding treatment in children is to prevent permanent damage to teeth and jaw joints. It can be treated gradually with follow-up using plates.
symptoms: Trauma marks on tongue and cheek

treatments.title: Night Guards
treatments.content: Custom-made night guards prepared by the dentist prevent tooth wear.

treatments.title: Stress Management
treatments.content: Counseling services can teach stress coping methods. Warm compresses can relieve muscle pain.

treatments.title: Bite Correction
treatments.content: Abnormal bite can be corrected with fillings, crowns or orthodontic treatments.

spacedTeeth.title: How is Spaced Teeth Treatment Done?
spacedTeeth.intro: The presence of an unwanted gap between two teeth is called diastema. Gaps between teeth can negatively affect a person's smile and self-confidence.
causes: Teeth being smaller than they should be
Insufficient development of teeth despite adequate jaw growth
Developmental disorder mostly seen in lateral incisors (lateral incisor hypoplasia)
Genetic numerical deficiency in teeth (congenital lateral deficiency)
High frenulum attachment between the two front incisors

treatments.title: Spaced Teeth Treatment with Composite Veneers
treatments.content: This treatment does not require local anesthesia and no tissue abrasion is performed. After detailed polishing and finishing processes, composite veneers become indistinguishable from natural teeth. Not suitable for cases with significant material loss or large gaps.

treatments.title: Spaced Teeth Treatment with Porcelain Veneers
treatments.content: Aesthetic appearance is achieved with minimal abrasions based on measurements taken from the patient's teeth. Glass ceramic material is used and bonded to teeth with special adhesives. Provides long-term use.

treatments.title: Spaced Teeth Treatment with Braces
treatments.content: Orthodontic treatment can be done with traditional braces or Invisalign. Detailed analyses are performed before treatment. Braces treatment is a permanent solution but takes longer than other methods.

spacedTeeth.conclusion: The first step in spaced teeth treatment is to determine the underlying cause of the problem. After examination, the appropriate treatment method can be decided.

toothYellowing.title: How to Prevent Tooth Yellowing? Why Do Teeth Turn Yellow?
toothYellowing.intro: Tooth yellowing can occur for several reasons. However, the underlying cause is not paying enough attention to oral and dental health. So, how can we prevent these yellowing? What are the reasons for its occurrence?
toothYellowing.methodsTitle: What are the Teeth Whitening Methods Applied by Dentists?

sections.title: What are the Causes of Tooth Yellowing?
items: Beverages such as wine, tea, and coffee

sections.title: How to Prevent Tooth Yellowing?
sections.content: The first thing to pay attention to is the food and drinks consumed. Your daily routine diet creates the most basic causes of oral and dental health. Along with this, your tooth brushing routine and how you brush are also very important. Cleaning the mouth after consuming sweets and using dental floss are often forgotten; however, this situation greatly affects overall oral and dental health. If you pay attention to your eating habits, do not use tobacco, and perform routine dental care but still experience yellowing problems, you should definitely see a dentist.

sections.title: What are the Treatment Methods for Tooth Yellowing?
sections.content: The most commonly applied method by patients at home is the brushing technique with baking soda. This technique can convince them that it is a treatment method that will be good for their teeth. However, long-term use of baking soda can cause permanent dental health problems. It is not possible for the patient to achieve long-term whiteness with techniques they see on the internet at home. Such alternative methods can cause bigger dental problems. If you want to get rid of yellow stains on your teeth and whiten them with healthy methods, consulting your dentist will be the most reliable method.

sections.title: Is the Effect of Teeth Whitening Permanent? How Long Does the Whitening Effect Last?
sections.content: With professional methods, you can eliminate yellow teeth and yellow stain formation on teeth in the long term. However, the effect of teeth whitening is not permanent. To prevent tooth yellowing from recurring, after having your teeth cleaned, you should give up habits that trigger the formation of yellow stains on teeth. For example, if you are a smoker and consume a lot of tea and coffee, it is beneficial to reduce it a bit. Because these habits are enemies of your tooth enamel and will bring back the yellow tooth stains that are your nightmare.

methods.title: In-Office Whitening
methods.content: In-office whitening is a type of whitening applied in a clinical setting. It is the most effective and reliable choice among all whitening methods. In a single session lasting about one hour, teeth can lighten by 3-4 shades. Having dental tartar cleaning done before this procedure will further increase its effectiveness.

methods.title: At-Home Whitening
methods.content: At-home whitening is a whitening method that the patient applies by themselves at home under the recommendation of the dentist. Before starting this method, first, the patient's mouth measurement is taken, and a suitable tray is prepared. Then, the prepared set containing a transparent tray and whitening agent is given to the patient. Thus, the patient can perform the treatment at home with peace of mind according to the dentist's instructions.

ImpactedTeeth.title: Impacted Tooth Extraction Treatment
ImpactedTeeth.definition: An impacted tooth is a tooth that has not erupted properly due to lack of space in the jawbone...
ImpactedTeeth.extractionProcess: Impacted teeth are usually removed surgically. This procedure is performed by a dentist or oral surgeon under local anesthesia...
ImpactedTeeth.recovery: Recovery time varies depending on the patient's age, general health and procedure difficulty, but usually heals completely within a few days or weeks.
ImpactedTeeth.wisdomTeethTitle: Why Do Wisdom Teeth Become Impacted?
wisdomTeethCauses: Presence of infection or cyst in the jaw
Diet of refined and soft foods
ImpactedTeeth.extractionNecessity: Not all wisdom teeth need to be extracted. Your dentist will decide after clinical and radiological examination...
ImpactedTeeth.extractionIndicationsTitle: When Should Wisdom Teeth Be Extracted?
extractionIndications: Pressure and pain on adjacent teeth

DentalCrowns.title: What Are the Types of Dental Crowns?
DentalCrowns.intro: Dental crowns are procedures applied when a tooth cannot be saved due to extensive decay...

types.name: Zirconium Crown
types.description: Zirconium crowns are currently the most recommended type of crown by dentists...

types.name: Laminate Veneer
types.description: Laminate veneer applications are among the frequently preferred treatments especially in smile design...
advantages: Ideal solution for cracks and chips

types.name: Metal-Based Crown
types.description: Metal-based dental crowns are the oldest type of crowns...

generalAdvantages: Offers chance to save damaged teeth

OrthodonticTreatments.title: What Are Orthodontic Treatments?
OrthodonticTreatments.intro: With advancing medicine and technology, orthodontic treatments can now be applied more quickly with a more aesthetic appearance...

treatments.name: Clear Aligner
treatments.description: Clear aligners, one of the treatment methods without braces or metal wires, are used to treat dental crowding. Since they are removable and transparent, they provide an aesthetic treatment option.

treatments.name: Braces
treatments.description: In this treatment method with wires and brackets, brackets are bonded to the tooth surface. The wire passing through the brackets applies force to the teeth. Colored or clear brackets can be chosen as preferred.

treatments.name: Fixed Space Maintainer
treatments.description: Applied when baby teeth are lost early, the fixed space maintainer is placed in the tooth gap until the permanent tooth erupts, preventing other teeth from shifting into the space.

treatments.name: Removable Retainer
treatments.description: Used to maintain tooth position after treatment, the removable retainer can also help in breaking thumb-sucking habits.

treatments.name: Jaw Appliances
treatments.description: Also known as splints, these appliances are placed on the upper or lower jaw to ensure proper jaw closure and are also used in treating temporomandibular joint disorders.

treatments.name: Palatal Expander
treatments.description: A palatal expander, made of plastic material that sits on the palate, helps widen the upper jaw.

treatments.name: Headgear
treatments.description: Wires attached to the front of the head are supported by a band at the back. It slows upper jaw growth while maintaining the position of back teeth and aims to move front teeth backward.

ImplantRecovery.title: Implant Recovery Process
ImplantRecovery.content1: Thanks to advancing technology, almost natural results are achieved in the treatment of tooth loss...
ImplantRecovery.healingProcessTitle: What is the recovery process like after implant treatment?
ImplantRecovery.healingProcessContent: The recovery process after implant treatment varies depending on the size of the operation area, the number of screws placed, the surgical technique, and most importantly, how you manage this process...
ImplantRecovery.woundHealingTitle: How many days does the implant wound heal?
ImplantRecovery.woundHealingContent: After a typical implant treatment, the recovery process may include mild swelling lasting a few days, tingling that can be controlled with simple painkillers, and sometimes bruising...
ImplantRecovery.postOpCareTitle: What Should Be Considered After Implant Treatment is Completed?
ImplantRecovery.postOpCareContent: After the implant treatment is finished, patients should not eat or drink anything for at least 2 hours...
ImplantRecovery.completeHealingTitle: When does the implant heal completely?
ImplantRecovery.completeHealingContent: The soft tissue healing that you can notice is completed in about 4-7 days...
ImplantRecovery.painTitle: Is there pain while implants are healing?
ImplantRecovery.painContent: In most implant treatments, the pain is much less than you expect...
ImplantRecovery.smokingTitle: Can I smoke during the recovery period?
ImplantRecovery.smokingContent: Tobacco and tobacco products can harm your implant's healing process...

ImplantLifetime.title: How Long Do Dental Implants Last?
ImplantLifetime.content1: Dental implants have been observed to last 30-40 years in the mouth, and sometimes even a lifetime without problems...
ImplantLifetime.factorsContent: The person's general health and, more importantly, oral and dental health directly affect the duration...
ImplantLifetime.extendLifeTitle: What Should Be Done to Extend the Life of Dental Implants?
extendLifeList: Pay attention to oral and dental health
Use of dental floss and oral irrigators
ImplantLifetime.hygieneContent: Implant care should not be neglected just because implants are not at risk of decay and wear...

Orthodontics.title: What is Orthodontics?
Orthodontics.content1: Orthodontics is a branch of dentistry that deals with the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of improper positions of teeth and jaws...
whoNeedsList: Cases where teeth cannot align properly due to lack of space
Cases where teeth are too spaced out
Cases where front teeth protrude excessively
Thumb sucking habit in children over 4 years
Orthodontics.startingAgeTitle: At What Age Should Orthodontic Treatment Begin?
Orthodontics.startingAgeContent: Orthodontic treatment begins with early check-ups. Therefore, children around 6 years old should definitely be examined...
Orthodontics.durationTitle: How Long Does Orthodontic Treatment Take?
Orthodontics.durationContent: Depending on the classification, orthodontic treatments can take between 1 to 3 years...
Orthodontics.careTipsTitle: Things to Consider During Orthodontic Treatment

seo.title: Dental Treatments at Orange Dent Clinic
seo.description: Discover a variety of dental treatments including implants, aesthetic dentistry, and orthodontics at Orange Dent Clinic.
seo.keywords: dental treatments, implants, aesthetic dentistry, orthodontics, dental care

Implants.whatistypofImplants: What are the types of implants?
Implants.implantApply: What are the implant application methods?
Implants.MainContent: Implants are titanium screws that are used to treat missing teeth and are placed inside the jawbone. The dental prosthesis is placed on these screws. The advantage of implant treatment over other treatments is that neighboring teeth are not harmed. In other words, neighboring teeth do not need to be cut. The implant acts as a tooth root and you can eat, talk and laugh comfortably like a natural tooth. Dental implant surgery also involves a surgical process that replaces the tooth roots with metal, screw-like posts and replaces damaged or missing teeth with artificial teeth that look and function very much like real teeth. Dental implants can offer a nice alternative to poorly fitting dentures or bridges and are therefore preferred over traditional bridges.

3dDentistry.whatisapplyof3dDentistry: What are the stages of digital dentistry?
3dDentistry.implantApply: What are the implant application methods?

3dDentistrySteps.item1Content: The patient comes to the clinic, the teeth to be treated are scanned in 3D with digital scanners. In this way, the 3D image of the tooth is transferred to the virtual environment.
3dDentistrySteps.item2Content: The tooth design is done digitally on the scan image. All processes such as the shape of the tooth, its contours, and its compatibility with the gum are designed in a computer environment.
3dDentistrySteps.item3Content: After the digital design is completed, it is time for production. The tooth is produced using the 3D printers in our clinic.
3dDentistrySteps.item4Content: The porcelain teeth produced in our clinic are ready for application, the final checks of the new teeth are made in the mouth and applied to the patient.

3dDentistry.MainContent: The question of what is digital dentistry is among the topics that many people have been wondering about recently. Digital dentistry is a field where devices, techniques and new technologies that are fully or partially supported by computers are used during diagnosis, planning and treatment. Digital dentistry is among the new generation methods developed to greatly reduce human errors, increase precision in production and shorten the duration of treatments a little bit more. In the field of digital dentistry; many applications that come to mind such as filling, complicated implant treatments, smile design, aesthetic planning, orthodontic procedures and porcelain coating can be performed. Each of these procedures is performed using digital technologies and modern devices.

SingleToothImplant.title: Is Single Tooth Implant Possible?
SingleToothImplant.content1: The single tooth implant procedure is the beginning of processes that will be completed in a very short time and successfully. First, it is checked whether there is sufficient bone tissue for the area with the missing tooth. The operation is completed with a procedure that will take 15-30 minutes. Leaving missing teeth empty can cause many different problems in the future.
SingleToothImplant.advantagesTitle: What is the Advantage of Single Tooth Implant?
SingleToothImplant.advantagesContent: In previous years, single tooth deficiency was treated with porcelain bridges. For the construction of porcelain bridge teeth, the teeth in front of and behind the missing tooth were reduced in size and used as support legs in the construction of the 'bridge'. Thus, the legs and the missing tooth area were treated with a three-membered bridge prosthetic tooth in total. The advantage of implant treatment in single tooth deficiency is that the tooth deficiency is eliminated without touching other healthy teeth. In this way, the teeth around the missing tooth continue to function in a healthy way.
SingleToothImplant.boneTitle: Can Implant Treatment Be Applied When There Is Not Enough Bone?
SingleToothImplant.boneContent: One of the factors that most affect the life of the implant is the presence of healthy bone that will surround the implant. If there is suitable bone tissue, the implant can be placed without any problems. In cases where there is not enough bone, very successful results are achieved with bone powder or bone graft taken from the patient's own tissue.
SingleToothImplant.priceContent: Price is one of the most frequently asked questions. This pricing varies according to the exchange rates of world-famous dental implants from Swedish, Swiss, German and American brands. Contact us for the most accurate information.
SingleToothImplant.lifetimeTitle: How Long Does a Single Tooth Implant Last?
SingleToothImplant.lifetimeContent: It has been observed that the lifespan of an implant tooth can last 30-40 years in the mouth, even a lifetime without any problems. The question of how long an implant lasts depends on many factors. The person's general health and, more importantly, oral and dental health directly affect the duration.
SingleToothImplant.recoveryTitle: How Many Days Does It Take to Recover After Implant Treatment?
SingleToothImplant.recoveryContent: What is the recovery process like after implant treatment? It varies depending on the size of the operation area, the number of screws placed, the surgical technique, and most importantly, how you manage this process. The time required for the healing of a single implant wound and the healing time of bone powder application will not be the same.
